subject: Re: [junit] splitting this list
msgSnippet: ... But, you fail to consider that for some people (especially in different cultures) the first way to help yourself may be to ask a question.  You have also
messageBody:
On 09/21/2005 01:22 PM, Bradley, Todd apparently said:

> I consider it rude for people to not have the courtesy to at least
> make an effort to help themselves.

But, you fail to consider that for some people (especially in different
cultures) the first way to help yourself may be to ask a question. You
have also failed to consider that in some countries Google is not
necessarily a buzz-word, so the question may not be directed there. I
don't mean to say that I know for a fact that either of these things is
the case, but I think it's worth the consideration that it may be the
case -- in which case it is a fine and expected thing to see the same
"newbie" question 10, 20, or even 30 times in a month.

I too get tired of the same ol' questions, but the same ol' response of
a Google search is valid and, at the very least, polite.

--
Jason Rogers

"I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
me, and gave himself for me."
Galatians 2:20
